comments:
IBM JRE V142 should be upgraded supported for Eclipse 302.
Here's the log contents:

FH, didn't we see something like this before?

I apologize for the delay in responding to this.  I actually switched from the IBM JRE to the Sun HotSpot JRE:
java version "1.4.2_11"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2_11-b06)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.2_11-b06, mixed mode)
and the same error but with more details:
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi Apr 04, 2006 12:41:47.980
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1
java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: C:\Program Files\Eclipse Workbench\eclipse301\pl
ugins\org.eclipse.swt.win32_3.0.1\os\win32\x86\swt-win32-3063.dll: Access is den
ied
        at java.lang.ClassLoader$NativeLibrary.load(Native Method)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary0(ClassLoader.java:1586)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1495)
        at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:788)
I then changed the .dll file permissions and (if it did not work the first time) changed another .dll (or so)'s permission, given the same error and everything seems to work after that is done.

I have seen how unzipping Windows .zip files with cygwin unzip libraries does not provide for proper permissions but I'm not 100% sure if I used cygwin unzip libraries to perform the unzip of the Eclipse files I downloaded for both 301 & 302 (Eclipse).  

Hope this helps, perhaps some better documentation using IBM JRE may help troubleshoot this issue for others in the future.

Thanks,
-Michel
Not sure if this is the same problen?  The original error was ExceptionInInitializerError and the new error is UnsatisfiedLinkError.

I would have to invite you to attempt to reproduce it.  This, though, seems to be (to me) the difference in messages when using 2 different JDKs.  I have not, however, attempted to use the IBM JDK when "fixing" the permission issues that the Sun JDK noted.  I have, however, been using Eclipse with the Sun JDK and it works just fine after resolving the issues noted by the JDK and the messages which I showed in my last bug report entry.

Hope that helps.
I have no idea what is happening, however Eclipse 3.0.2 is really old.  Does the same thing happen in 3.2 M6?

The first time I opened this bug report was for the IBM JVM, thinking that there was some lack of support issue for "newer" VMs.  I am pretty sure at this point that is not the case but I will find out and document the better details and see if this is potentially a user-error which, when using the Sun JVM presents itself in a different manner, making it clear to understand the problem at-hand.  
There may be some documentation which may help overall but I'd have to do a bit more work to see exactly what that may be.
Thanks for your time.
